content.2: What mean ye, that ye use this proverb concerning the land of Israel, saying, The fathers have eaten sour grapes, and the children’s teeth are set on edge?
content.4: Behold, all souls are mine; as the soul of the father, so also the soul of the son is mine: the soul that sinneth, it shall die.
content.5: But if a man be just, and do that which is lawful and right,
content.9: Hath walked in my statutes, and hath kept my judgments, to deal truly; he
content.11: And that doeth not any of those
content.12: Hath oppressed the poor and needy, hath spoiled by violence, hath not restored the pledge, and hath lifted up his eyes to the idols, hath committed abomination,
content.13: Hath given forth upon usury, and hath taken increase: shall he then live? he shall not live: he hath done all these abominations; he shall surely die; his blood shall be upon him.
content.16: Neither hath oppressed any, hath not withholden the pledge, neither hath spoiled by violence,
content.19: Yet say ye, Why? doth not the son bear the iniquity of the father? When the son hath done that which is lawful and right,
content.20: The soul that sinneth, it shall die. The son shall not bear the iniquity of the father, neither shall the father bear the iniquity of the son: the righteousness of the righteous shall be upon him, and the wickedness of the wicked shall be upon him.
content.21: But if the wicked will turn from all his sins that he hath committed, and keep all my statutes, and do that which is lawful and right, he shall surely live, he shall not die.
content.22: All his transgressions that he hath committed, they shall not be mentioned unto him: in his righteousness that he hath done he shall live.
content.23: Have I any pleasure at all that the wicked should die? saith the Lord
content.24: But when the righteous turneth away from his righteousness, and committeth iniquity,
content.25: Yet ye say, The way of the Lord is not equal. Hear now, O house of Israel; Is not my way equal? are not your ways unequal?
content.28: Because he considereth, and turneth away from all his transgressions that he hath committed, he shall surely live, he shall not die.
content.29: Yet saith the house of Israel, The way of the Lord is not equal. O house of Israel, are not my ways equal? are not your ways unequal?
content.30: Therefore I will judge you, O house of Israel, every one according to his ways, saith the Lord
content.31: Cast away from you all your transgressions, whereby ye have transgressed; and make you a new heart and a new spirit: for why will ye die, O house of Israel?
content.32: For I have no pleasure in the death of him that dieth, saith the Lord
